intro: Polygala mcvaughii, commonly known as the McVaugh's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family, which includes about 2,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and usually have a distinctive, spurred structure, which is characteristic of the genus Polygala. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
